main_definition: Percentage is a way of expressing a proportion or ratio as a fraction of 100, often used to describe how one quantity compares to another.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A part of a whole expressed as a number out of 100
meanings_and_examples.example: If there are 50 red balls and 100 total balls, the percentage of red balls is 50%.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A measure used to compare quantities or changes relative to their original amount
meanings_and_examples.example: The population increased by 2% last year compared to the previous year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A way of expressing probability as a fraction out of 100
meanings_and_examples.example: There is a 75% chance that it will rain today according to the weather forecast.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in statistics and business to analyze data, trends, and changes over time
meanings_and_examples.example: The company's revenue grew by 10% this quarter compared to last quarter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A way of expressing a ratio or comparison between two values using the base value as reference
meanings_and_examples.example: If you scored 25 out of 30 on a test, your score is 83.3% (approximately) based on the total possible points.
